subject: Communication
title: Global Virtual Teams: The New Frontier
description: A short lesson to help you apply Global Virtual Teams: The New Frontier.

hook.text: A team spans five time zones. The American wants quick decisions. The Japanese wants consensus.

buildup.text: Remote work amplified cross-cultural challenges: fewer nonverbal cues, more misinterpreted emails, and time zone.

discovery.text: Studies show virtual teams need 2-3x more explicit communication to achieve the same understanding as co-located teams.

twist.text: Technology doesn't eliminate cultural difference. It amplifies it â€” digital communication strips away vital context cues.

climax.text: Successful global teams create 'cultural contracts' â€” explicit agreements about communication norms, decision-making.

punchline.text: Global teams don't fail from distance. They fail from assumed sameness.

quiz.question: How much more explicit communication do virtual teams need?
